section.para: &outposts; enables native &AWS; services, infrastructure, and operating models in on-premises facilities. In &outposts; environments, you can use the same &AWS; APIs, tools, and infrastructure that you use in the &AWS; Cloud. &MESH; on &outposts; is ideal for low-latency workloads that need to be run in close proximity to on-premises data and applications. For more information about &outposts;, see the &AWS; Outposts User Guide.
The following are the prerequisites for using &MESH; on &outposts;:

listitem.para: You must have installed and configured an Outpost in your on-premises data center.
You must have a reliable network connection between your Outpost and its &AWS; Region.
The &AWS; Region for the Outpost must support &MESHlong;. For a list of supported Regions, see &MESHlong; Endpoints and Quotas in the &AWS-GEN-REF;.

section.para: The following are the limitations of using &MESH; on &AWS; Outposts:

listitem.para: &IAMlong;, &ALB;, &NLB;, &CLB;, and &R53long; run in the &AWS; Region, not on Outposts. This will increase latencies between these services and the containers.

section.para: The following are network connectivity considerations for &EKS; &outposts;:

listitem.para: If network connectivity between your Outpost and its &AWS; Region is lost, the &MESH; Envoy proxies will continue to run. However you will not be able to modify your service mesh until connectivity is restored.
We recommend that you provide reliable, highly available, and low-latency connectivity between your Outpost and its &AWS; Region.

info.title: Creating an &MESH; Envoy proxy on an Outpost

section.para: An Outpost is an extension of an &AWS; Region, and you can extend an Amazon VPC in an account to span multiple Availability Zones and any associated Outpost locations. When you configure your Outpost, you associate a subnet with it to extend your Regional VPC environment to your on-premises facility. Instances on an Outpost appear as part of your Regional VPC, similar to an Availability Zone with associated subnets.

To create an &MESH; Envoy proxy on an Outpost, add the App Mesh Envoy container image to the &ECS; task or &EKS; pod running on an Outpost. For more information, see &ECSlong; on &AWS; Outposts in the &guide-ecs-dev; and &EKSlong; on &AWS; Outposts in the &guide-eks-user;.
